member.name: T:Artemis.ComponentPoolMultiThread`1

summary.para: A collection that maintains a set of class instances
to allow for recycling instances and
minimizing the effects of garbage collection.

member.typeparam: The type of object to store in the Pool. Pools can only hold class types.

summary.para: Cleans up the pool by checking each valid object
to ensure it is still actually valid.
Must be called regularly to free returned Objects.

member.name: M:Artemis.Interface.IComponentPool`1.New
member.summary: Gets a new object from the Pool.
member.returns: The next object in the pool if available, null if all instances are valid.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: initialSize and resizePool must be at least 1.

member.name: M:Artemis.ComponentPoolMultiThread`1.CleanUp
member.summary: Cleans up the pool by checking each valid object to ensure it is still actually valid. Must be called regularly to free returned Objects

member.name: M:Artemis.ComponentPoolMultiThread`1.New
member.summary: Returns a new object from the Pool.
member.returns: The next object in the pool if available, null if all instances are valid.
member.exception: Limit Exceeded components.Length, and the pool was set to not resize
The pool's allocate method returned a null object reference.

member.summary: Return an object to the pool

member.summary: Gets the number of valid objects in the pool.

member.name: P:Artemis.ComponentPoolMultiThread`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a valid object at the given index. The index must fall in the range of [0, ValidCount].
member.returns: A valid object found at the index
member.exception: The index must be less than or equal to ValidCount.

member.summary: Basic unity of this entity system.

member.summary: The unique id. This ID is unique in Artemis (even if the Entity is reused) This value can be SET when building the Entity (passed as a parameter to EntityWorld.CreateEntity)

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Artemis.Entity.GetComponent(Artemis.ComponentType)

summary.para: Gets the component.
Slower retrieval of components from this entity.
Minimize usage of this, but is fine to use e.g. when
creating new entities and setting data in components.

member.returns: component that matches, or null if none is found.

member.name: M:Artemis.Entity.GetComponent``1

summary.para: Gets the component.
This is the preferred method to use when
retrieving a component from a entity.
It will provide good performance.

member.returns: component that matches, or null if none is found.

member.name: M:Artemis.Entity.HasComponent``1
member.summary: Determines whether this instance has a specific component.
member.returns: if this instance has a specific component; otherwise, .

summary.para: Refreshes this instance.
Refresh all changes to components for this entity.
After adding or removing components,
you must call this method.
It will update all relevant systems.
It is typical to call this after adding components
to a newly created entity.
Removes the component.
Faster removal of components from a entity.

member.name: M:Artemis.Entity.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

summary.para: Gets all components belonging to this entity.
Warning: Use only for debugging purposes, it is dead slow.
The returned bag is only valid until this method is called
again, then it is overwritten.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is enabled.

summary.para: Gets the internal id for this entity within the framework.
No other entity will have the same ID,
but ID's are however reused so another entity may acquire
this ID if the previous entity was deleted.

members.member: Called when [added]. The entity. Called if the system has received a entity it is interested in, e.g. created or a component was added to it. @param entity the entity that was added to this system.
Called when [change]. The entity. Called if a entity was removed from this system, e.g. deleted or had one of it's components removed. @param entity the entity that was removed from this system.

summary.para: The fast date time.
The standard DateTime.Now call produces more garbage
and is slower. For Windows NT 3.5 and later the timer
resolution is approximately 10 milliseconds.
